clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Recovery Changes in Subacute Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Dynamic Time Series Data Collection for Functional Recovery Changes in Sub-acute Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: In subacute stroke patients, dynamic time series data of brain imaging and motor function measurement were obtained from 7 days to 6 months (total 9 times) after stroke onset

primary_outcome.measure: Mechanism of recovery of motor function according to recovery of sub-acute stroke
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Mechanism of recovery of motor function calculate by repeated measurement method in physical and cognitive functions data and MRI data of brain

primary_outcome.measure: Mechanism of recovery of gait function according to recovery of sub-acute stroke
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Mechanism of recovery of motor function calculate by repeated measurement method in 3D motion capture system and electromyography (EMG) data and MRI data of brain

arm_group.description: More than 1 week post-stroke Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke

intervention.intervention_name: Data acquisition of functional abilities in sub-acute stroke
intervention.description: MRI data, motor evoked potentials, gait function and behavior data acquisition

study_pop.textblock: A person who was inpatient at sub-acute stage at the Samsung Medical Center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- at least 19 years of age hemiplegic stroke patients
- Subacute-phase ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients within 7 days of onset
- Functional Ambulation Category Scale (FAC) of 3 or less, 7 days of onset,
- A person who understands and voluntarily participates in this study and signs a research agreement
Exclusion Criteria:
- User of artificial heartbeat
- Patients with claustrophobia
- Patients with metal implants
- Patients who are contraindicated for other common MRI
- Patients with mild motor impairment with an FMA score of 80 or higher
- Patients whose conscious state is coma and who have no response at all
- Patients who can not independently gait with the Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 4 or more before the onset of disease
